intro: Erodendrum incomptum, commonly known as the slender erodendrum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Erodendrum incomptum is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
